uses.foreignSentence: Mis padres vienen de Mexico.
uses.englishSentence: My parents are from Mexico.

uses.foreignSentence: Esta mesa está hecha de plástico.
uses.englishSentence: This table is made of plastic.
Madrid is the capital of spain.
uses.foreignSentence: Madrid es la capital de España.

uses.englishSentence: Isn't that Susan's house? / Isn't that the house of susan's?
uses.foreignSentence: Esa no es la casa de Sasana?

uses.englishSentence: The food was of great quality
uses.foreignSentence: La comida era de gran calidad.

uses.englishSentence: Andres always carried around a bag of marbles
uses.foreignSentence: Andrés siempre llevaba una bolsa de canicas

uses.englishSentence: I'm going to buy another bathing suit (suit of bathing) for the summer
uses.foreignSentence: Voy a comprar otro traje de baño para el verano

uses.englishSentence: It is better to work in the morning
uses.foreignSentence: Es mejor trabajar de mañana.

uses.englishSentence: I caught myself crying with (/ from) sorrow when I thought of her.
uses.foreignSentence: Me sorprendi llorando de pena al pensar en él.

uses.englishSentence: Take a piece of bread
uses.foreignSentence: Toma un trozo de pan.

uses.englishSentence: He's the tallest of them all.
uses.foreignSentence: Es el más alto de todos. (más ___ de)

uses.englishSentence: Did you say the letter d or t?
uses.foreignSentence: ¿Dijiste la letra de or te?

uses.englishSentence: Note that some of these characteristics are different
uses.foreignSentence: Tenga en cuenta que algunas de estas características son diferentes.
uses.useDetails: Used to introduce a subordinate clause

uses.englishSentence: It's cheaper to buy the book in the bookstore than to buy it online.
uses.foreignSentence: Es más barato comprar el libro en la librería que comprario online.

uses.englishSentence: I prefer small stores to big supermarkets
uses.foreignSentence: Prefiero las tiendas pequeñas que los grandes supermercados.

uses.englishSentence: The man who (/ that) saved my baby's life is here.
uses.foreignSentence: El hombre que le salvó la vida a mi bebé está aqui.

uses.englishSentence: The book which (/ that) has had the greatest influence on me is this one.
uses.foreignSentence: El libro que más ha influido en mí es este.

uses.englishSentence: There's no door on the roof of my car.
uses.foreignSentence: No hay puerta en techo de mi coche

uses.englishSentence: It's not raining
uses.foreignSentence: No está lloviendo.

uses.englishSentence: A non-governmental organization is an association that operates independently of government.
uses.foreignSentence: Una organización no gubernamental es una asociación que actúa con independencia del gobierno.

uses.englishSentence: We're going to the party tonight, aren't we?
uses.foreignSentence: Vamos a la fiesta esta noche ¿no?

uses.englishSentence: We're going to the party tonight, aren't we?
uses.foreignSentence: Vamos a la fiesta esta noche ¿no?
